rights.description: Public body must respond within 5 working days of receipt (day after request received is day one)
rights.conditions: Hard 5 working day deadline unless extension granted
rights.implementation_notes: Requests after 5 PM considered received next working day; business day count starts day after receipt
rights.request_tips: Track working days from day after submission - 5 day maximum without extension

rights.description: May extend only 7 additional working days with written explanation (12 working day maximum total)
rights.conditions: Must explain conditions making 5-day response impossible
rights.implementation_notes: Extension must be justified in writing - cannot be automatic
rights.request_tips: If extended beyond 5 days, demand written explanation; total cannot exceed 12 working days

rights.description: Court may award reasonable costs and attorney fees to prevailing petitioner
rights.request_tips: If wrongfully denied, attorney fees recoverable if you prevail in court

rights.description: Burden on public body to justify denial
rights.implementation_notes: Requester does not need to prove entitlement - agency must justify denial
rights.request_tips: If denied, agency bears burden to prove exemption applies

rights.description: No identification or purpose statement required; may be oral or written (written recommended)
rights.implementation_notes: Cannot ask why you want records or who you are
rights.request_tips: You do not need to identify yourself or state your purpose

rights.description: Custodian of records designated for each public body
rights.request_tips: Direct requests to designated custodian of records

rights.conditions: Public body must accept electronic requests
rights.implementation_notes: Email and other electronic methods valid
rights.request_tips: Submit via email for documentation and faster delivery

rights.description: Liberally construed to promote awareness of governmental activities; exemptions narrowly construed
rights.implementation_notes: Creates strong presumption in favor of disclosure
rights.request_tips: Cite liberal construction mandate when challenging restrictive interpretations

rights.description: Must make reasonable efforts to reach agreement with requester on response format and timing
rights.implementation_notes: Agencies cannot unilaterally dictate terms - must negotiate in good faith
rights.request_tips: If agency imposes unreasonable terms, cite requirement to reach mutual agreement

rights.description: Must provide access to inspect records during business hours
rights.request_tips: Request in-person inspection to review before requesting copies

rights.description: Virginia Freedom of Information Advisory Council provides guidance, training, and dispute resolution assistance
rights.conditions: Available to all requesters and public bodies
rights.implementation_notes: Free advisory opinions and mediation services available at foiacouncil.dls.virginia.gov
rights.request_tips: Contact FOIA Advisory Council for guidance before litigation - may resolve disputes informally

rights.description: Policy of VFOIA is to promote awareness and understanding of governmental activities; presumption of openness
rights.implementation_notes: Strong presumption that records are public unless specifically exempt
rights.request_tips: Cite presumption of openness when challenging denials

validation_metadata.notes: All rights extracted from verified jurisdiction-data.json file. Virginia has strong requester protections including: 5 working day response with strict 7-day extension limit (12 days maximum), burden of proof on agency, liberal construction mandate, FOIA Advisory Council for dispute resolution, and requirement to reach mutual agreement on response terms.
